headline: Apple Adds a Bear as Jefferies Downgrades, Sees 20% Downside
summary: Analyst Edison Lee cut his rating on the stock to underperform from hold, writing that the stock’s current valuation prices in an “overly bullish iPhone outlook.”  The stock’s consensus recommendation — a proxy for the ratio of buy, hold, and sell ratings — now stands at 3.93 out of five, making Apple the least-loved of the Magnificent Seven except for Tesla Inc. Even so, bearish ratings for the stock are relatively rare.

This partnership signals Nebius Group’s rise as a critical supplier for large-scale cloud-based AI compute, directly addressing ongoing data center capacity shortages in the industry. headline: Huawei Used TSMC, Samsung, SK Hynix Components in Top AI Chips
summary: TechInsights discovered gear from Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co., Samsung Electronics Co. and SK Hynix Inc. in multiple samples of Huawei’s third-generation Ascend 910C chips, the firm said in a statement.  In an investigation, the Ottawa-based researchers concluded that TSMC manufactured the dies used in the Huawei accelerators.

headline: OpenAI Tie-Up Boosts Hitachi Shares, Fuels Japan Tech Rally
summary: The strategic partnership will involve collaboration on Hitachi’s energy and power grid operations, cooling equipment, storage and its digital solutions hub Lumada, a Hitachi representative told Bloomberg.  Hitachi and OpenAI signed a memorandum of understanding on Oct. 2, the Japanese company said in a post on social media site X.  Growing collaboration with US firms is adding fuel to Japan’s tech stock rally, which has already helped power the nations’ equity benchmarks to all-time highs.

raw.headline: OpenAI Tie-Up Boosts Hitachi Shares, Fuels Japan Tech Rally
raw.summary: The strategic partnership will involve collaboration on Hitachi’s energy and power grid operations, cooling equipment, storage and its digital solutions hub Lumada, a Hitachi representative told Bloomberg.  Hitachi and OpenAI signed a memorandum of understanding on Oct. 2, the Japanese company said in a post on social media site X.  Growing collaboration with US firms is adding fuel to Japan’s tech stock rally, which has already helped power the nations’ equity benchmarks to all-time highs.

headline: Tech fans Tokyo rally on broadly positive day for Asian markets
summary: A surge in tech firms helped Tokyo's Nikkei lead most Asian equities higher on Friday as investors headed into the weekend on a broadly positive note, with US rate-cut hopes out-muscling concerns about a government shutdown.The advance helped push Tokyo's Nikkei sharply higher, while there were also gains in Sydney, Wellington, Taipei, Jakarta and Manila.

raw.headline: Tech fans Tokyo rally on broadly positive day for Asian markets
raw.summary: A surge in tech firms helped Tokyo's Nikkei lead most Asian equities higher on Friday as investors headed into the weekend on a broadly positive note, with US rate-cut hopes out-muscling concerns about a government shutdown.The advance helped push Tokyo's Nikkei sharply higher, while there were also gains in Sydney, Wellington, Taipei, Jakarta and Manila.

headline: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan Backs $24M Corintis Board As Startup Solves AI's Biggest Bottleneck Problem
summary: Semiconductor cooling startup Corintis announced on Sept. 25 that it closed a $24 million Series A funding round and a collaboration with Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) that achieved a breakthrough chip cooling system three times more effective than current technology. Lip-Bu Tan became a board director and investor at Corintis prior to his appointment as Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) CEO, Corintis said. According to Corintis, BlueYard Capital led the round, with participation from Founderful, Acequia Capital, C

headline: Delays to Trump’s U.A.E. Chips Deal Frustrate Nvidia’s Jensen Huang
summary: The multibillion-dollar deal was announced in May, but Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick has since pushed the U.A.E. for certain U.S. investments first.
